Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: One day last fall, Bryant Woods’ rotted-out flooring opened up beneath his 11-year-old daughter.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Bryant Woods is a tenant whose rental home had significant issues, leading to a dispute with his landlord.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: About nine months ago, the two men agreed he could withhold rent until repairs were made, he said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Bryant Woods is a tenant whose rental home had significant issues, leading to a dispute with his landlord.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Then, recently, his landlord caught him by surprise and filed for eviction.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Bryant Woods is a tenant whose rental home had significant issues, leading to a dispute with his landlord.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: He left the courthouse without much hope.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Bryant Woods is a tenant whose rental home had significant issues, leading to a dispute with his landlord.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: To reduce such evictions, one of the court’s judges, Deborah Henderson; Shelby County Commissioner Erika Sugarmon; and Cindy Ettingoff, then-CEO of Memphis Area Legal Services, last summer secured $240,000 in the county budget to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: The cash didn’t make it to MALS until February 2024, due to problems with how the County Commission resolution was originally drafted, Henderson said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: But Henderson has been happy with the results since then.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Recently, MALS worked with a woman who was living in a house that “should not be lived in by anyone” and was starting to fall behind on rent, Henderson said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Though the program has only helped a couple of tenants so far — not 300 — Henderson believes it’s already proving its value.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “There are no income limits or income requirements,” Henderson told a WLOK-AM audience earlier this summer.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Nicole Grida, the new MALS CEO, said her team has started creating marketing materials for the program, building partnerships with local nonprofits and screening folks who call in for other services to see if they will fit the program’s criteria, which has resulted in many promising leads.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Nicole Grida is the new CEO of Memphis Area Legal Services, leading the implementation of the mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: For the program to succeed, Grida said raising greater awareness will be key, as most Memphians it could help don’t yet know it exists.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Nicole Grida is the new CEO of Memphis Area Legal Services, leading the implementation of the mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Woods’ case, for instance, sounded like a perfect fit for mediation, Henderson said, if only they’d found him before the eviction was filed.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We could have drafted a document that ensured the landlord (followed the verbal agreement),” she said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Though the mediation program just launched, it’s going to have to quickly prove its impact.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Its leaders are scheduled to present to the County Commission at the end of 2024, in hopes they can receive additional county funding after this first $240,000 runs out in February 2025.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Meanwhile, Grida said MALS is looking for other funders interested in backing the effort.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Nicole Grida is the new CEO of Memphis Area Legal Services, leading the implementation of the mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Henderson believes the program will require a much longer pilot period before it’s able to produce the proof necessary to create a housing court.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: But, despite the rough start, she remains “very hopeful” for its future.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Deborah Henderson is one of the court’s judges who helped secure funding for a pre-litigation mediation program.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: To reduce such evictions, one of the court’s judges, Deborah Henderson; Shelby County Commissioner Erika Sugarmon; and Cindy Ettingoff, then-CEO of Memphis Area Legal Services, last summer secured $240,000 in the county budget to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The initial goal was for MALS to use the money to hire a few employees — including a former code inspector since property conditions almost always drive the disputes.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The nonprofit would then find tenants and landlords who seemed headed toward eviction and prevent at least 300 evictions — all in a year.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: The founders hoped this type of impact would prove the need for a specialized housing court in Shelby County, where judges could take a property’s condition into account when deciding eviction cases — as opposed to simply whether a tenant was behind on rent.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: By then, Ettingoff was no longer with MALS, and the interim executive director, Loyce Lambert Ryan, was dealing with the fallout of a major cyber attack.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Ultimately, MALS wasn’t able to launch the program in earnest until June.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Recently, MALS worked with a woman who was living in a house that “should not be lived in by anyone” and was starting to fall behind on rent, Henderson said.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: But with MALS’ help, the landlord is making repairs, and the tenant is using some leftover rental assistance funds to catch up on rent.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: To drum up more business, Henderson and MALS attorney Cedric Harris, who is leading the program, have been spending a few nights and weekends this summer speaking to churches, on radio shows and at other events.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Nicole Grida, the new MALS CEO, said her team has started creating marketing materials for the program, building partnerships with local nonprofits and screening folks who call in for other services to see if they will fit the program’s criteria, which has resulted in many promising leads.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Memphis Area Legal Services is a nonprofit organization that secured funding to pilot a pre-litigation mediation program for landlord-tenant disputes.
